summary: TKD Prompt 8. Nervous about a test/tournament (Ironhusbands)
body:
TKD Prompt 8. Nervous about a test/tournament (Ironhusbands)

This isn’t dead, if anyone cares! Also this actually has a specific time period bc I actually went to worlds in 2016 in Brighton so this actually takes place at that time!

Also I did not sleep on that flight.

Sleeping on airplanes was almost impossible. The loud noise from being thirty thousand feet up in a plane already made it a challenge, but Tony was also stressed out of his mind.

He’d been fretting over the world championships this whole time, and now that he was on the flight to London, he couldn’t relax.

A day and a half in London to sightsee and recover from jet lag, and then a full week in Brighton at the world championships.

He would be sparring.


He leaned forward, anxiously bouncing his leg. Maybe he wouldn’t wake his boyfriend up if the plane was loud enough.

It wasn’t.

“Tony? What’s up? Can’t sleep?” Rhodey asked, rubbing his eyes.

“No…”

“Come here.”

Rhodey pushed the armrest up and allowed Tony to scoot closer to him. He put an arm around Tony and pulled him in, letting Tony rest his head on his shoulder. Tony could see the J. Rhodes on his team USA jacket, reminding him of the reality of his situation.

“We’re… we’re really doing this, huh? You’re on all the team events, and I’m… I’m not all that good at sparring, honey bear, you know that! I can’t do this.”

“Yes you can,” Rhodey insisted. “You’re on the team for a reason. You’re great, phenomenal. You’ll be fine.”

He rubbed Tony’s arm and kissed him on the forehead.

“You’re just trying to make me feel better.”

“Well, you can’t exactly go into this feeling bad. Come on. You need to sleep.”

“I’ll be jet lagged no matter what.”

“I know, baby. We can sleep when we get to the hotel if you want.”

“Can we cuddle?”

“Of course.”

summary:
The Avengers based on my series so far.
Tony: Hides in his lab whenever the team takes over the family floor, not bothering to...
body:
The Avengers based on my series so far.

Tony: Hides in his lab whenever the team takes over the family floor, not bothering to check if Rhodey or Stephen are monitoring the team. Complains about the team taking over his living space but doesn’t do anything because spending time with the team makes Peter happy.

Stephen: Only signed up to parent Peter but somehow ended up with the Avengers as well, and desperately trying to keep all of them in check. Whenever he has to leave, he sometimes loathes coming back because he knows something will have gone wrong. He sometimes regrets leaving the Sanctum.

Rhodey: Makes sure Tony and Stephen don’t lose their collective minds because of said team.

Peter: Gives his parents more grey hairs and while he doesn’t always join in on the team’s chaos he always somehow gets dragged into it. Always tries to spend time with his parents every day, even if it’s only an hour. He knows how easy it is to lose someone.

Clint: Only behaves when his family visits the tower, otherwise he’s usually right with Scott and Sam causing problems.

Scott: Flirts at (Not with because Stephen doesn’t return the attraction) Strange and occasionally makes heart eyes at him whenever Mama Bear comes out. Gets into trouble with Clint and Sam.

Sam: For some reason leaves maturity for missions or behind in his room when he goes up to the family floor. Helps cause problems with Clint and Scott.

Bucky: Sticks to cooking/baking and ignoring the chaos that is the Avengers. Absolutely makes sure any recipe he uses doesn’t call for any form of peppermint so Peter can enjoy it.

Steve: Draws/sketches and stays out of the others trouble but doesn’t try to stop it either. The Cap Glare isn’t nearly as effective as the Mama Bear Glare, so he stopped trying.

Natasha: She revels in the chaos but is protective enough of Peter that if it looks like he’s in over his head, she’ll distract him with something else, or trip up whoever is being too rough. Otherwise she reads or sits with Bucky if he’s cooking/baking.

Thor: Comes and goes. On the rare occasion he’s on the family floor when someone starts something, either joins in or goes into the kitchen for a beer. Depends on his mood.

Loki: Basically like Natasha but sticks with reading. He’s familiar with chaos so it doesnt bother him. Sometimes plays chess with Peter during a rare occurrence of calm.

Bruce: Flees to his or Tony’s lab when there’s any kind of hint that trouble is brewing. The last thing they need is Hulk deciding it’s a good idea. Otherwise, reads or watches tv with the more responsible adults.

Wanda: Mostly keeps to herself. She rolls her eyes when trouble starts but goes back to knitting or crocheting (she seems the type to me) or spending time with Vision.

Vision: Attempts to cook, not very well. So he spends most of his time with Wanda and reading as well.

*BONUS Levi: If it gets left behind for some odd reason, it stays in its corner unless Peter gets into trouble or harms way, then swaddles him and takes the teen to his room until Stephen or Tony get back (show their face) and get Levi to release Peter. If this happens, Peter just asks Karen to turn the tv on in his room.

**Let it be known the family floor is NOT the designated common area. It’s literally where Tony, Stephen, and Peter live. Their floor.**

**If I forgot anyone, let me know so I can edit this**

Bucky: Sticks to cooking/baking and ignoring the chaos that is the Avengers. Absolutely makes sure any recipe he uses doesn’t call for any form of peppermint so Peter can enjoy it.

Steve: Draws/sketches and stays out of the others trouble but doesn’t try to stop it either. The Cap Glare isn’t nearly as effective as the Mama Bear Glare, so he stopped trying.

Natasha: She revels in the chaos but is protective enough of Peter that if it looks like he’s in over his head, she’ll distract him with something else, or trip up whoever is being too rough. Otherwise she reads or sits with Bucky if he’s cooking/baking.

Thor: Comes and goes. On the rare occasion he’s on the family floor when someone starts something, either joins in or goes into the kitchen for a beer. Depends on his mood.

Loki: Basically like Natasha but sticks with reading. He’s familiar with chaos so it doesnt bother him. Sometimes plays chess with Peter during a rare occurrence of calm.

Bruce: Flees to his or Tony’s lab when there’s any kind of hint that trouble is brewing. The last thing they need is Hulk deciding it’s a good idea. Otherwise, reads or watches tv with the more responsible adults.

Wanda: Mostly keeps to herself. She rolls her eyes when trouble starts but goes back to knitting or crocheting (she seems the type to me) or spending time with Vision.

Vision: Attempts to cook, not very well. So he spends most of his time with Wanda and reading as well.

*BONUS Levi: If it gets left behind for some odd reason, it stays in its corner unless Peter gets into trouble or harms way, then swaddles him and takes the teen to his room until Stephen or Tony get back (show their face) and get Levi to release Peter. If this happens, Peter just asks Karen to turn the tv on in his room.

**Let it be known the family floor is NOT the designated common area. It’s literally where Tony, Stephen, and Peter live. Their floor.**

**If I forgot anyone, let me know so I can edit this**
trail.content:
The Avengers based on my series so far.

Tony: Hides in his lab whenever the team takes over the family floor, not bothering to check if Rhodey or Stephen are monitoring the team. Complains about the team taking over his living space but doesn’t do anything because spending time with the team makes Peter happy.

Stephen: Only signed up to parent Peter but somehow ended up with the Avengers as well, and desperately trying to keep all of them in check. Whenever he has to leave, he sometimes loathes coming back because he knows something will have gone wrong. He sometimes regrets leaving the Sanctum.

Rhodey: Makes sure Tony and Stephen don’t lose their collective minds because of said team.

Peter: Gives his parents more grey hairs and while he doesn’t always join in on the team’s chaos he always somehow gets dragged into it. Always tries to spend time with his parents every day, even if it’s only an hour. He knows how easy it is to lose someone.

Clint: Only behaves when his family visits the tower, otherwise he’s usually right with Scott and Sam causing problems.

Scott: Flirts at (Not with because Stephen doesn’t return the attraction) Strange and occasionally makes heart eyes at him whenever Mama Bear comes out. Gets into trouble with Clint and Sam.

title: Gone, but Never Forgotten
body:
Characters: Tony Stark x Reader, Bucky Barnes

Word Count: 1,754

Warnings: being shot at, angst, fluff

Summary: Instead of worrying Tony, you decided to hide an injury that just might cost you your life.

Squared Filled: Hiding an Injury // Mission Gone Wrong // Shoot First, Ask Never

Author’s Note: I know you guys have requests and I promise to get to them. I have two bingos I need to finish before the deadline in Aug/Sept and by the rate I am going, I will be done before that so please bear with me. This is for @badthingshappenbingo and @tonystarkbingo and @buckybarnesbingo and if you have any requests, please send them in! This is unbeta’d and any and all mistakes are all on me.

Feedback the glue that holds my writing together

Tags at the bottom

“Are we really taking care of this? Look at them, they are climbing the side of the building trying to break in. I call this a step down from our other missions,” you said in your ear comm. Fury wanted you and Tony to take care of this problem before it escalated into something worse, but how much worse could it get?

“Would you just focus?” Tony asked as he did a once over around the building. He got the easy job; all he was good for was flying and FRIDAY.

“Come on, they’re common thieves. We should let PD handle this. Let’s just call them and go back to the tower,” you complained, watching as the two thieves continued to climb.

“Y/N, focus! Seriously!” Tony snapped.

“Uh, boss?” FRIDAY said from both ear comms. Tony made it possible for you to hear her in your ear as well as in his suit. He trusted you enough to let you in on the potential dangers.

“What is it, FRIDAY?” you asked the AI.

“They have a bomb on them that is powerful enough to level the city. The higher they go, the more fatalities there will be.”

“Oh yeah, now I see the problem,” you spoke and sighed.

“Y/N, can you get a clear shot?” your boyfriend asked. Raising your specialized gun, you smirked as you locked onto the target.

“Do I ever miss?” Currently, you are the best markswoman known to man. There isn’t a target you can’t hit, and almost everyone wanted you to do their dirty work. You have superhuman like senses that allow you to see the world through a different eye. There was one time that you were able to hit a target that Tony was flying around at top speed with your eyes closed. Not being able to miss is a given due to your skills.

The only special thing about you was the serum you got when Steve had gotten his. The only thing it provided you with was that it could slow down your aging. It gave you a longer lifespan to get your dirty work done. You and Steve had been the ultimate fighting couple before he went under. After he resurfaced, things seemed to pick up right where they left off. However, when he surfaced, your heart belonged to Tony. Now, it was you and Tony who was the ultimate fighting couple.

“I would advise against that Miss Y/L/N,” FRIDAY spoke up.

“Why?” you asked as you kept your target locked.

“One hit and that bomb goes off. Either way, the city is gone.”

“Then what the hell are we supposed to do?”

“I’m going to talk to them. They’re a couple of kids. FRIDAY get Wanda here. She can contain the blast.”

“Yes, boss.”

“Tony, what are you doing?” you asked in a slight panic.

“I’m going to go talk to them.”

“Tony don’t you dare!” you exclaimed just as he went off the air. “FUCK!” Looking around for a way to the roof, you couldn’t help but feel eyes on you. Whoever was watching you, you knew they didn’t have good intentions.

“Tony, please answer me,” you said into your ear comm. When you received no answer, that is when you started to panic. The kids made it to the roof of the building they were climbing, and you started to walk to the entrance of the building. If breaking the door down means helping Tony, then you were going to do just that. As soon as you rounded the corner, paid started spreading from your side. Looking down, you saw a pool of blood growing from where the pain was. On the ground next to you was a bullet. Whoever shot you must have the world’s quietest gun because you didn’t hear a thing.

Your legs wobbled in protest, and you fell to the ground. Your mind finally caught up with what was happening, and you cried out in pain as you clutched your side. Tony wasn’t answering, someone shot you, and kids might blow up the entire fucking city. What else could go wrong?

“Y/N are you there?” Tony spoke through the comm.

“Yeah, I’m here,” you said as evenly as you possibly could. There was no way you were going to tell Tony that you were just shot. It was his idea to leave you on the ground since he thought you could get a better shot from down there even though you told him you could get a shot from anywhere. He would be overridden with guilt, and you didn’t need that. As long as you got to the tower, you could patch this up yourself.

“Are you okay? I got the kids to give me the bomb. Wanda and Vision are here now. They are going to take these kids to PD. Where are you? We’re going home.”

“On the ground,” you said as you mentally slapped yourself. Tony could not see what had happened to you. Luckily for you, your jacket was dark and could cover up the color of blood. With all the strength you had, you forced yourself to get up. Your hands were shaky, your skin was pale, and your breathing was ragged. It would take a lot of power to try and convince your boyfriend that nothing was wrong with you.

Taking off your jacket, you wiped the blood off your hands before tying it around your waist, making sure to put pressure on the wound. All you wanted to do was scream at the top of your lungs and cry, but when you saw the Quinjet, you forced those feelings deep inside you. When Tony landed the bird, you immediately got on. Tony then had FRIDAY take you back to the tower on autopilot.

“Hey, you okay?” he asked as he placed the bomb carefully in a glass protector case.

“Yeah,” you nodded curtly before walking away from him.

“Are you sure, you’re looking a little pale.”

“I’m fine, Tony. Really. I just need silence, please,” you pleaded, hoping he would give you what you wanted. If you talked anymore, your voice might give you away.

“Yeah, okay,” he sighed as he walked back to the pilot’s seat. As soon as he turned away from you, a tear rolled down your cheek.

********************************************************************************************

The first thing you did when Tony landed the bird back at the tower was rush to the nearest bathroom. He didn’t question a thing but stayed back to make sure the bomb was safely carried inside, and to check to make sure the Quinjet was okay before shutting her off.

Slamming the bathroom door shut, you let out a small whimper of pain before taking off your jacket. The pain in your side had shot up to your arm, causing it to hurt with the slightest bit of movement. So, you tried your best to peel off your shirt with one hand. As soon as it was off, you dropped it to the floor and watched as buckets of blood began to pour from your wounds. There was an enter and exit hole from where the bullet traveled.

Grabbing Tony’s nice white towels, you placed one over your wounds to try and get the bleeding to stop, but that only made the towel turn red. The blood would not stop flowing, and you were sure that you would die from blood loss if the bleeding didn’t stop anytime soon. Your skin was pasty white, your hands shook from the pain, and your head started to feel dizzy. As you reached for the second towel hanging from the rack, your hand slipped, and you fell to the ground. There wasn’t enough strength in you to get up, and there was no way to contact Tony to come and help you.

There was only you.

Tony had just finished checking some things off when he noticed a small pool of blood from where you were sitting the whole time. He looked on the landing and saw a few smaller pools of blood, and he immediately knew something was wrong. Dropping whatever he had in his hand, he followed the trails of blood to the bathroom. In your busy mind, you forgot to lock the bathroom so Tony was able to get in easily.

He didn’t like what he saw.

“FRIDAY! Call an ambulance!”

“Yes, boss,” she replied.

“Y/N, wake up,” he panicked, looking at your wound which was still gushing blood. He grabbed a clean towel from the rack and placed it over the wounds with immense pressure to get the bleeding to stop.

“Y/N! Please!”

********************************************************************************************

The pain in your side was still there, but it didn’t hurt as much as it did before. All you could hear was the beeping coming from your heart monitor and Tony who was pacing the floor of your hospital room.

“Tony,” you whispered when you opened your eyes. He immediately came to your side and took your hand.

“What were you thinking?”

“I know, I know. I was stupid. Someone shot me, and I didn’t… I couldn’t see them. I didn’t hear it… I didn’t want you to worry,” you took deep breaths between each pause.

“Seeing you half dead on the bathroom floor made me worry. I’ll find out who did this to you, but please, don’t ever hide this from me. You lost a lot of blood and you weren’t waking up. You fucking scared me.”

“I’m sorry,” you sighed.

“You’re okay now. The wounds are closed and your blood is staying right where it belongs.”

“I love you,” you smiled.

“I love you too,” he said before kissing your forehead.

********************************************************************************************

“Did you do it? Did you complete your mission?”

“Yes, I did. I shot and killed Y/N Y/L/N,” Bucky said in a monotone voice.

“You sure she is dead?”

“I watched her take her last breath myself,” he lied.

“Excellent. You’ll make a fine soldier when we’re finished with you,” one of HYDRA’s personnel smiled wickedly. Bucky looked up at the man who had been experimenting on him from the beginning. His mission was to kill you, but for some reason, he only grazed your side. HYDRA can mess with his head all they want, but they can never erase the memory of you from his brain. The memories of the two of you together, being happy. He could never kill the love of his life, no matter how much they fuck with his brain.

********************************************************************************************

If you want to be tagged, add yourself to this document! If your tag doesn’t work, find out why!

@likiyoshi-lijie  @gh0stgurl  @until-theend-oftheline  @2dreamcatcher8  @thisismysecrethappyplace  @paintballkid711  @linkpk88  @vvishous  @bemyqueenofdarkness  @wittysunflower  @thejourneyneverendsx  @cutelittlepurplesouls @feelmyroarrrr  @jointhehunt67  @rayvenrider  @xxloki81xx  @fandomgirl17  @fatbottomedgeek  @ivvitm1109  @kendall-michele  @niall2017  @schwankyblock  @mackevanstanfan80  @fuckthatfeeling  @tardis-is-mine  @awkwardfangirl2014  @kpoplover1306-depressedgirl315

[[MORE]]

“What is it, FRIDAY?” you asked the AI.

“They have a bomb on them that is powerful enough to level the city. The higher they go, the more fatalities there will be.”

“Oh yeah, now I see the problem,” you spoke and sighed.

“Y/N, can you get a clear shot?” your boyfriend asked. Raising your specialized gun, you smirked as you locked onto the target.

“Do I ever miss?” Currently, you are the best markswoman known to man. There isn’t a target you can’t hit, and almost everyone wanted you to do their dirty work. You have superhuman like senses that allow you to see the world through a different eye. There was one time that you were able to hit a target that Tony was flying around at top speed with your eyes closed. Not being able to miss is a given due to your skills.

The only special thing about you was the serum you got when Steve had gotten his. The only thing it provided you with was that it could slow down your aging. It gave you a longer lifespan to get your dirty work done. You and Steve had been the ultimate fighting couple before he went under. After he resurfaced, things seemed to pick up right where they left off. However, when he surfaced, your heart belonged to Tony. Now, it was you and Tony who was the ultimate fighting couple.

“I would advise against that Miss Y/L/N,” FRIDAY spoke up.

“Why?” you asked as you kept your target locked.

“One hit and that bomb goes off. Either way, the city is gone.”

“Then what the hell are we supposed to do?”

“I’m going to talk to them. They’re a couple of kids. FRIDAY get Wanda here. She can contain the blast.”

“Yes, boss.”

“Tony, what are you doing?” you asked in a slight panic.

“I’m going to go talk to them.”

“Tony don’t you dare!” you exclaimed just as he went off the air. “FUCK!” Looking around for a way to the roof, you couldn’t help but feel eyes on you. Whoever was watching you, you knew they didn’t have good intentions.

“Tony, please answer me,” you said into your ear comm. When you received no answer, that is when you started to panic. The kids made it to the roof of the building they were climbing, and you started to walk to the entrance of the building. If breaking the door down means helping Tony, then you were going to do just that. As soon as you rounded the corner, paid started spreading from your side. Looking down, you saw a pool of blood growing from where the pain was. On the ground next to you was a bullet. Whoever shot you must have the world’s quietest gun because you didn’t hear a thing.

Your legs wobbled in protest, and you fell to the ground. Your mind finally caught up with what was happening, and you cried out in pain as you clutched your side. Tony wasn’t answering, someone shot you, and kids might blow up the entire fucking city. What else could go wrong?

“Y/N are you there?” Tony spoke through the comm.

“Yeah, I’m here,” you said as evenly as you possibly could. There was no way you were going to tell Tony that you were just shot. It was his idea to leave you on the ground since he thought you could get a better shot from down there even though you told him you could get a shot from anywhere. He would be overridden with guilt, and you didn’t need that. As long as you got to the tower, you could patch this up yourself.

“Are you okay? I got the kids to give me the bomb. Wanda and Vision are here now. They are going to take these kids to PD. Where are you? We’re going home.”

“On the ground,” you said as you mentally slapped yourself. Tony could not see what had happened to you. Luckily for you, your jacket was dark and could cover up the color of blood. With all the strength you had, you forced yourself to get up. Your hands were shaky, your skin was pale, and your breathing was ragged. It would take a lot of power to try and convince your boyfriend that nothing was wrong with you.

Taking off your jacket, you wiped the blood off your hands before tying it around your waist, making sure to put pressure on the wound. All you wanted to do was scream at the top of your lungs and cry, but when you saw the Quinjet, you forced those feelings deep inside you. When Tony landed the bird, you immediately got on. Tony then had FRIDAY take you back to the tower on autopilot.

“Hey, you okay?” he asked as he placed the bomb carefully in a glass protector case.

“Yeah,” you nodded curtly before walking away from him.

“Are you sure, you’re looking a little pale.”

“I’m fine, Tony. Really. I just need silence, please,” you pleaded, hoping he would give you what you wanted. If you talked anymore, your voice might give you away.

“Yeah, okay,” he sighed as he walked back to the pilot’s seat. As soon as he turned away from you, a tear rolled down your cheek.

********************************************************************************************

The first thing you did when Tony landed the bird back at the tower was rush to the nearest bathroom. He didn’t question a thing but stayed back to make sure the bomb was safely carried inside, and to check to make sure the Quinjet was okay before shutting her off.

Slamming the bathroom door shut, you let out a small whimper of pain before taking off your jacket. The pain in your side had shot up to your arm, causing it to hurt with the slightest bit of movement. So, you tried your best to peel off your shirt with one hand. As soon as it was off, you dropped it to the floor and watched as buckets of blood began to pour from your wounds. There was an enter and exit hole from where the bullet traveled.

Grabbing Tony’s nice white towels, you placed one over your wounds to try and get the bleeding to stop, but that only made the towel turn red. The blood would not stop flowing, and you were sure that you would die from blood loss if the bleeding didn’t stop anytime soon. Your skin was pasty white, your hands shook from the pain, and your head started to feel dizzy. As you reached for the second towel hanging from the rack, your hand slipped, and you fell to the ground. There wasn’t enough strength in you to get up, and there was no way to contact Tony to come and help you.

There was only you.

Tony had just finished checking some things off when he noticed a small pool of blood from where you were sitting the whole time. He looked on the landing and saw a few smaller pools of blood, and he immediately knew something was wrong. Dropping whatever he had in his hand, he followed the trails of blood to the bathroom. In your busy mind, you forgot to lock the bathroom so Tony was able to get in easily.

He didn’t like what he saw.

“FRIDAY! Call an ambulance!”

“Yes, boss,” she replied.

“Y/N, wake up,” he panicked, looking at your wound which was still gushing blood. He grabbed a clean towel from the rack and placed it over the wounds with immense pressure to get the bleeding to stop.

“Y/N! Please!”

********************************************************************************************

The pain in your side was still there, but it didn’t hurt as much as it did before. All you could hear was the beeping coming from your heart monitor and Tony who was pacing the floor of your hospital room.

“Tony,” you whispered when you opened your eyes. He immediately came to your side and took your hand.

“What were you thinking?”

“I know, I know. I was stupid. Someone shot me, and I didn’t… I couldn’t see them. I didn’t hear it… I didn’t want you to worry,” you took deep breaths between each pause.

“Seeing you half dead on the bathroom floor made me worry. I’ll find out who did this to you, but please, don’t ever hide this from me. You lost a lot of blood and you weren’t waking up. You fucking scared me.”

“I’m sorry,” you sighed.

“You’re okay now. The wounds are closed and your blood is staying right where it belongs.”

“I love you,” you smiled.

“I love you too,” he said before kissing your forehead.

********************************************************************************************

“Did you do it? Did you complete your mission?”

“Yes, I did. I shot and killed Y/N Y/L/N,” Bucky said in a monotone voice.

“You sure she is dead?”

“I watched her take her last breath myself,” he lied.

“Excellent. You’ll make a fine soldier when we’re finished with you,” one of HYDRA’s personnel smiled wickedly. Bucky looked up at the man who had been experimenting on him from the beginning. His mission was to kill you, but for some reason, he only grazed your side. HYDRA can mess with his head all they want, but they can never erase the memory of you from his brain. The memories of the two of you together, being happy. He could never kill the love of his life, no matter how much they fuck with his brain.

********************************************************************************************

trail.content_abstract:
Characters: Tony Stark x Reader, Bucky Barnes

Word Count: 1,754

Warnings: being shot at, angst, fluff

Summary: Instead of worrying Tony, you decided to hide an injury that just might cost you your life.

Squared Filled: Hiding an Injury // Mission Gone Wrong // Shoot First, Ask Never

Author’s Note: I know you guys have requests and I promise to get to them. I have two bingos I need to finish before the deadline in Aug/Sept and by the rate I am going, I will be done before that so please bear with me. This is for @badthingshappenbingo and @tonystarkbingo and @buckybarnesbingo and if you have any requests, please send them in! This is unbeta’d and any and all mistakes are all on me.

Feedback the glue that holds my writing together

Tags at the bottom

“Are we really taking care of this? Look at them, they are climbing the side of the building trying to break in. I call this a step down from our other missions,” you said in your ear comm. Fury wanted you and Tony to take care of this problem before it escalated into something worse, but how much worse could it get?

“Would you just focus?” Tony asked as he did a once over around the building. He got the easy job; all he was good for was flying and FRIDAY.

“Come on, they’re common thieves. We should let PD handle this. Let’s just call them and go back to the tower,” you complained, watching as the two thieves continued to climb.

“Y/N, focus! Seriously!” Tony snapped.

“Uh, boss?” FRIDAY said from both ear comms. Tony made it possible for you to hear her in your ear as well as in his suit. He trusted you enough to let you in on the potential dangers.
